decks.notes: The main idea of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of creatures like Jadelight Ranger and Wildgrowth Walker, planeswalkers like Teferi and Tamiyo, and removal spells like Command the Dreadhorde. The deck focuses on card advantage and gaining life through the explore mechanic, while also being able to recur creatures and planeswalkers from the graveyard. The mana base is focused on providing the necessary colors for the spells in the deck, with a mix of shock lands, check lands, and utility lands like Interplanar Beacon.

The primary strategy of this deck is to control the board and gradually gain advantage through card advantage and life gain. The deck focuses on using cards like Jadelight Ranger, Merfolk Branchwalker, and Wildgrowth Walker to generate value while Tamiyo, Teferi, and Vraska provide powerful control options. Command the Dreadhorde is a key card in the deck, allowing the player to bring back key threats from the graveyard. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while Interplanar Beacon provides additional lifegain to help stabilize against aggressive decks.

This deck focuses on controlling the board early with removal spells and cheap creatures, while generating value with cards like Hero of Precinct One and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Liliana, Dreadhorde General to provide additional card advantage and threaten the opponent's resources. With a mix of proactive threats and disruptive spells, this deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan, ultimately overwhelming them with efficient threats and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing a mix of disruption, card advantage, and efficient creatures to apply pressure on the opponent. By combining cards like Thought Erasure and Teferi, Time Raveler for disruption, with powerful creatures like Thief of Sanity and Hostage Taker for card advantage, the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total. The use of a diverse mana base and planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria help to ensure consistency and versatility in gameplay.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to quickly pressure the opponent, disrupt their game plan, and control the board. It combines aggressive creatures like Thief of Sanity and Hero of Precinct One with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to generate value and maintain control. With a mix of removal spells and hand disruption, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while steadily advancing its own position to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures, disruptive spells, and powerful planeswalkers. By using cards like Thought Erasure, Thief of Sanity, and Tyrant's Scorn to disrupt the opponent's game plan and generate card advantage, while also deploying threats like Hero of Precinct One and Elite Guardmage to pressure the opponent's life total. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria allows for additional card advantage and control over the game. This deck aims to be proactive and versatile in its approach to win the game quickly.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It also includes burn spells like Lava Coil, Lightning Strike, and Shock to clear the way for its creatures and deal direct damage to the opponent. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence with cards like Growth-Chamber Guardian, Legion Warboss, and Skarrgan Hellkite, while also benefiting from the mana acceleration provided by cards like Paradise Druid and Llanowar Elves. The inclusion of The Immortal Sun helps to further boost the aggression of the deck and provide card advantage.

The main focus of this Gruul Aggro deck is to quickly develop a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures backed up by removal and support spells. Utilizing a combination of early mana acceleration with Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, alongside powerful threats like Growth-Chamber Guardian, Skarrgan Hellkite, and Rekindling Phoenix, the deck aims to apply pressure from the very beginning and maintain a tempo advantage. With cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas and Legion Warboss providing additional support, the deck seeks to close out games swiftly and decisively.

The main idea of the deck is to take advantage of aggressive and powerful creatures in the Gruul colors to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Gruul Spellbreaker, Skarrgan Hellkite, and Rekindling Phoenix provide strong threats that are difficult to deal with, while cards like Domri, Anarch of Bolas and The Immortal Sun help to support and boost the rest of the deck. By combining efficient creatures with removal spells like Lava Coil, Lightning Strike, and Shock, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent quickly. With a focus on powerful Gruul creatures like Rekindling Phoenix and Gruul Spellbreaker, along with efficient removal spells like Shock and Lightning Strike, this deck aims to apply pressure early and often. By utilizing cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Domri, Anarch of Bolas to ramp up mana and provide additional support, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault.

This Jeskai Planeswalker control deck focuses on using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful Planeswalker cards to control the board and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler to limit the opponent's options, along with sweepers like Deafening Clarion and spot removal like Lava Coil, the deck aims to keep the opponent's threats in check while building up its own board presence with Planeswalkers like Sarkhan the Masterless and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also includes Fblthp, the Lost as a recursive card draw engine to keep the card advantage flowing.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful planeswalkers such as Sarkhan the Masterless, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. This is achieved through a combination of counterspells like Negate and Spell Pierce, removal spells like Shock and Deafening Clarion, as well as disruptive enchantments like Ixalan's Binding. The deck also includes cards like Fblthp, the Lost and Kasmina, Enigmatic Mentor for additional card advantage and protection. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By leveraging cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy, the deck aims to maintain a constant stream of pressure on the opponent while also utilizing tools like Light Up the Stage to keep drawing fuel for its aggressive strategy. The deck's efficiency and speed make it a formidable force in Standard 1 vs 1 matchups.

The main focus of this deck is to efficiently deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It utilizes low-cost, aggressive creatures such as Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, along with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock to control the board and hit the opponent directly. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy to maintain momentum and keep the pressure on the opponent. Chandra, Fire Artisan provides additional damage and card advantage to help secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm and defeat the opponent by playing aggressive red creatures and burning spells. By consistently dealing damage early in the game, it aims to control the board and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. With a low mana curve, the deck aims to be fast and efficient, utilizing cards like Fanatical Firebrand, Ghitu Lavarunner, and Goblin Chainwhirler to establish early dominance. The inclusion of spells like Lightning Strike and Shock adds versatility and reach, ensuring the deck can deal damage both to creatures and directly to the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively pressure the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage. By efficiently utilizing cards like Fanatical Firebrand, Goblin Chainwhirler, and Lightning Strike, along with the powerful card advantage engine provided by Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The inclusion of Chandra, Fire Artisan adds an extra way to close out the game. Overall, this deck seeks to win as fast as possible through aggressive plays and efficient damage output.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, followed by powerful cards like Goblin Chainwhirler and Runaway Steam-Kin, you aim to deal damage to your opponent as fast as possible. Cards like Lightning Strike, Shock, and Wizard's Lightning help to clear the way or finish off your opponent. Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy provide card advantage and keep the pressure on. Overall, this deck is designed to win games through speed and aggression.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive red creatures and a low-cost burn spells. By utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, as well as powerful card advantage engines like Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy, this deck aims to apply constant pressure and finish the game as fast as possible. The inclusion of Chandra, Fire Artisan adds another source of damage and card advantage to ensure victory in a fast-paced and explosive manner.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By playing low-cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, alongside powerful cards like Goblin Chainwhirler and Runaway Steam-Kin, the deck aims to deal damage efficiently. Lightning Strike, Shock, and Wizard's Lightning provide additional reach and removal, while Light Up the Stage and Experimental Frenzy help maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure. The deck's strategy is to maintain a fast pace and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing low-cost red creatures and spells. By using cards like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, along with burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and reduce the opponent's life total rapidly. Additionally, cards like Experimental Frenzy and Chandra, Fire Artisan provide card advantage and additional damage potential. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and efficient aggression, ultimately leading to victory.

This aggressive red deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently, using cards like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler to control the board while pumping out damage with cards like Viashino Pyromancer and Lightning Strike. Runaway Steam-Kin and Chandra, Fire Artisan provide additional power and card advantage, while Experimental Frenzy allows for explosive turns. Light Up the Stage helps maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and spells, focusing on dealing damage quickly and efficiently. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Ghitu Lavarunner, along with powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, the deck aims to control the board and push for a fast victory. Runaway Steam-Kin and Experimental Frenzy provide additional card advantage and mana acceleration, while Light Up the Stage allows for extra card draw to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and direct damage spells. By utilizing cheap and efficient creatures like Ghitu Lavarunner and Viashino Pyromancer, as well as powerful direct damage spells like Lightning Strike and Shock, this deck aims to quickly chip away at the opponent's life total. Cards like Runaway Steam-Kin and Chandra, Fire Artisan provide additional value and card advantage, while Experimental Frenzy allows for explosive turns by allowing the player to play multiple cards from the top of their deck.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively dealing damage to the opponent through a mix of low-cost creatures and burn spells. It aims to establish early board presence with creatures like Fanatical Firebrand and Goblin Chainwhirler, while also utilizing cards like Light Up the Stage to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of powerful burn spells like Lightning Strike and Carnival / Carnage allows the deck to finish off the opponent even if they stabilize the board. Tibalt, Rakish Instigator is included to disrupt the opponent's life gain strategies.

This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells while ramping up its own mana with mana dorks and lands for big payoffs like Hydroid Krasis and Mass Manipulation. Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides additional ramp and power, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with large creatures and stolen permanents. The deck focuses on maintaining board control and card advantage to outvalue the opponent and secure a victory through superior resources and threats.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by ramping with mana dorks like Llanowar Elves and Incubation Druid, while also gaining card advantage with cards like Jadelight Ranger and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales. The ultimate goal is to play powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Nissa, Who Shakes the World to overwhelm the opponent. Nexus of Fate is used to take extra turns and ensure the deck can keep up with other decks in the late game. Blast Zone is included as a versatile removal option. Overall, the deck focuses on maintaining control and outvaluing the opponent through efficient card advantage and powerful threats.

The main idea behind this Simic Control deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Llanowar Elves and Growth Spiral, while controlling the board with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Blast Zone. Utilizing powerful card draw options like Hydroid Krasis and Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, the deck aims to outvalue opponents and maintain control through counterspells like Blink of an Eye. The end goal is to eventually loop extra turn spells like Nexus of Fate to overwhelm opponents with an insurmountable advantage.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with creatures like Llanowar Elves and Paradise Druid, while gaining life and card advantage with Wildgrowth Walker and explore creatures. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with strong threats like Hydroid Krasis and Jadelight Ranger, while using cards like Hostage Taker and Command the Dreadhorde to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Tamiyo to provide additional card advantage and control options. The overall goal is to apply consistent pressure and outvalue the opponent to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to control the board and maintain card advantage. It utilizes cards like Llanowar Elves and Wildgrowth Walker to ramp up mana and gain life, while also incorporating cards like Jadelight Ranger and Merfolk Branchwalker to explore, dig for resources, and put pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Vivien Reid, along with versatile removal spells like Assassin's Trophy and Vraska's Contempt. Additionally, it incorporates cards like Hostage Taker and Ravenous Chupacabra to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy through counter spells and removal while steadily drawing cards to maintain resources. By utilizing efficient removal spells like Vraska's Contempt and board wipes like Cry of the Carnarium, combined with card advantage from cards like Chemister's Insight and Chart a Course, the deck aims to out-value the opponent and eventually win the game with powerful threats like Thief of Sanity and God-Eternal Kefnet. The deck's win condition is to outlast the opponent and overwhelm them with card advantage and powerful creatures.

The focus of this deck is to quickly play out efficient threats like Arclight Phoenix, Crackling Drake, and Goblin Electromancer while using cheap spells like Lightning Strike, Opt, Shock, and Spell Pierce to control the board and keep the pressure on the opponent. Chart a Course and Radical Idea help to draw into more threats and fuel the graveyard for Arclight Phoenix, while Finale of Promise allows for powerful late-game plays. Lava Coil and Tormenting Voice provide additional removal and card advantage, allowing the deck to maintain tempo and aggression throughout the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence with cheap spells and aggressive creatures, particularly wizards. By utilizing cheap spells like Shock and Wizard's Lightning, along with creatures like Adeliz, the Cinder Wind and Dreadhorde Arcanist, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and pressure the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Chart a Course and Naru Meha, Master Wizard provide additional card advantage and versatility to keep up the aggression. The mana base is optimized to ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful spells and creatures.
